data.title: Google Answers: Searching for Sci
data.text:
Request for Question Clarification by juggler-ga on 10 Nov 2006 23:36 PST

Hi, The basic plot of a character figuring out that he is really a robot is fairly common in science fiction. There are dozens of novels and short stories based on that premise. Can you remember any other details beyond the Midwest locale? In approximatley what year do you believe that this novel was published?

Request for Question Clarification by hummer-ga on 11 Nov 2006 04:47 PST

Hi gmichel, Does "Roderick" ring a bell? Originally published in the early 1980s, it is the autobiography of Roderick the robot. Book 1: RODERICK or The Education of a Young Machine Book 2: RODERICK AT RANDOM or Further Education of a Young Machine Books 1 & 2: THE COMPLETE RODERICK by John Sladek Description: Roderick Or The Education Of A Young Machine John Sladek "Roderick is a robot who learns. Adopted by friendly small-town folks, Roderick is brought up a s a 'real' boy - or that's the idea. " Very funny." http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=515379186&searchurl=bx%3Doff%26ds%3D30%26bi%3D0%26an%3Dsladek%26y%3D0%26bsi%3D180%26tn%3DRoderick%26x%3D0%26sortby%3D2 Image: Book 1 http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=274796526&searchurl=bx%3Doff%26ds%3D30%26bi%3D0%26an%3Dsladek%26y%3D0%26bsi%3D30%26tn%3DRoderick%26x%3D0%26sortby%3D2 Image: Book 2 http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=749262944&searchurl=bx%3Doff%26sts%3Dt%26ds%3D30%26bi%3D0%26an%3Dsladek%26y%3D0%26tn%3Droderick%2Brandom%26x%3D0%26sortby%3D2 Image: Complete Roderick "Roderick is a robot and this is his autobiography. Sladek conveys, with great sensitivity and insight the innocence of an artificial intelligence and asks profound questions about mankind?s right to manipulate others. It also portrays how a numerological mind might structure a narrative." http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Roderick-John-Sladek/dp/1585675873/sr=8-1/qid=1163248965/ref=sr_1_1/104-6342998-5317531?ie=UTF8&s=books Regards, hummer
